website_summaries.verdict: If you don't mind putting in a minimal amount of networking elbow grease in exchange for paying your Internet provider less money every month, check out Netgear's High Speed Cable Modem (CMD31T).
pros: Saves on leasing fees for ISP's equipment
No noticeable difference in browsing experience over using ISP's modem
Works with most major cable Internet service
cons: May require you to set up your wireless router again

customer_reviews.title: An OK modem, but not amazing.  Others out there are better for your money.  Won't buy neatgear modem again.
customer_reviews.text: Owned it for 4.5 years before it started malfunctioning. I have other netgear equipment that is many years older that is still going strong, therefore I'm disappointed in this modem. It would be going along fine and suddenly just go blank and the internet would disconnect. I'd have to power cycle it to get it going again, but then another problem came about that the power connection was appearing to be faulty. All and all this unit was not meant to last more than a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Devan Munn

customer_reviews.title: Dead out of the box
customer_reviews.text: This modem unit never worked. It was an exact replacement for a unit I’ve had for years but after it needed a reboot after getting warm, I ordered this to replace the old one. Out of the box the lights were very dim and it never activated the router. The return shipping costs me more then half the cost of the unit which I had to pay. Then the refund took an awful long time to get even after calling to complain. I will never buy anything from Import2all-LLC again.
customer_reviews.author: Fletch

customer_reviews.title: Cable Modem Replacement and upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I chose Netgear to make certain the modem would easily work with my existing router. It worked perfectly first try. I did call the cable company first. They required a few details. Then I plugged it in. Everything worked instantly. I even was in the same chat room where i'd been talking with a tech about the installation. A few processes had to re-align (like outlook settings) but everything else was handled automatically. I didn't even need to reboot. I haven't lost connection since the install, which means a stability problem I had that caused me to upgrade has successfully been corrected. I would recommend this modem, at least at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Mac Author Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great Modem for Xfinity/Comcast
customer_reviews.text: I have used this modem for Xfinity/Comcast service for the past 3 years. It works great, I haven't really had a problem with it dropping service. I would say once every 6+ months things get a little slow. When that happens I do a power reset and all the green lights come back. When you call and talk to Xfinity, just remember to provide them the MAC address and force them to keep at it from their side till it works. I have moved twice and both times service continued in the new place. Remember that when you call for support, their first response will be to blame it on your equipment. Just keep them honest and it will work.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Bell

customer_reviews.title: DOCSIS 3.0
customer_reviews.text: Used as a replacement for the Comcast box that you have to rent every month, this is a very nice looking design and it quite fast. It should be remembered that because the difference isn't going to be that big, and especially since cable fluctuates as more people in your neighborhood use it, it's difficult to get a true benchmark comparison. However I use internet every day, I did notice a bit of speed, but to be honest if you're renting a modem from Comcast you're getting bent over each month, buy this and a year later it pays for itself. Highly recommended, installation was cake.
customer_reviews.author: artv4nd3l4y

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable Cable connection with at least my shipped product.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this through Amazon and upon receipt it appear that Box was opened but it still looked new. I reported that it is possible that this unit was used and then possibly returned. Since I needed it to enable my internet service n a scheduled date at a remote location I decided to go ahead and utilize it. It worked fine for about 4 weeks and then thereafter it continually lost sync(once per week) with the cable head end requiring manual power cycling/intervention for recovery. After about 6 total long term internet outages and interventions I decided to toss it. The cable connection is now stable.
customer_reviews.author: johnnymo

customer_reviews.title: Got instant speedup
customer_reviews.text: Hi, With timewarner-provided "cable modem" ($10/m) I always had 5-13Mb/s speed despite of paying for 50Mb/s. I tried almost everything and even started thinking about switching to other provider but as the last attempt tried to change cable modem itself. And it WORKED! With this NetGear box I instantly got 52+Mb/s ! I wish I discovered it earlier. The hardiest part of whole work was to get TimeWarner support switch MAC address in my account. I spend maybe 40 mins on phone. Also keep in mind that this model has no built-in WiFi output, so you need separate router with wifi (I already had, so it wasn't a problem for me).
customer_reviews.author: Vladimir Ignatov

customer_reviews.title: Took only minutes - Works Great - Saving $8 per month!
customer_reviews.text: Actually bought this modem back in June and it sat under my desk... until we received a notice from Time Warner last week, telling us that their monthly modem "rent" was going up to $8.00 !!! It's a no-brainer... took all of 2 minutes tow swap it out.. then of course 15 minutes on hole with TWC to activate... which took only about 30 seconds, and another 30 minute wait to turn theirs back in. The Modem works fine!
customer_reviews.author: R. L. Carr

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't Work With Samsung Smart Hub TV
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I had one in another house (with different internet provider) that worked fine with a Smart Hub TV. However, it also had a Netgear router as well. Maybe that was the issue, but this one absolutely would not send a signal to a Smart Hub through a different brand of wireless router. All the tech support says a signal is a signal, but it just wasn't worth the frustration. I returned it and ordered a different modem of the same brand that is currently working with my current cable provider.
customer_reviews.author: Deb D

customer_reviews.title: I guess what I am saying is - the product is great, it came quickly and the dealer and manufacturer ...
customer_reviews.text: I made a mistake and ordered this item thinking it was a modem and router. It was my error, but it came up when I searched for combos and all the other ones on the page were modem/router combos. The price was the clue and I didn't take it. I guess what I am saying is - the product is great, it came quickly and the dealer and manufacturer did everything they were supposed to. I still have to go get a new router and will have two pieces for another five years.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer Guy

customer_reviews.title: Time Warner Cable - Works!
customer_reviews.text: I get full speed and stable connection. Only one tech issue ever came up where the modem and TWC could not make a link together, so TWC created a customized authorized signal to re-establish connection when various reboots and reauthorizations had failed us. For anyone with no to little tech skills, this is a very simple and easy unit. It works seamlessly with the wireless router of the same body style (which I dont have the model, I am disabled by 4 cats sleeping in my lap)
customer_reviews.author: Remrie Arrie

customer_reviews.title: Works adequately for low demand needs
customer_reviews.text: It kind of worked. My phone kept telling me the my internet connection was unstable. One of my Tivo Minis kept dropping due to no connection to my main DVR. So after 3 months of rocky use, I traded it in for a Motorola Surfboard 400 Series modem - Model SB6141. It did technically work the entire time and worked better when I swapped out some older cable splitters. I think if a person doesn't put a lot of demand on it as occurs with the establishment of a MoCA network, it would work fine.
customer_reviews.author: PowerShopper

customer_reviews.title: Good one
customer_reviews.text: My ISP installed an Arris modem in my house years ago. They had to tweak it every few months and come by about twice a year to replace it. I got tired of the crap and bought this. My internet speed increased and stayed increased. I love Netgear. I have a Netgear router and WAP in my house and Netgear router and Ubiquiti WAP in my office. I'll replace the Arris in my office next. From a technician's perspective Netgear is easy to program for port forwarding and other things and they just work.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Gray

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy used.
customer_reviews.text: Dud not last long just stopped working, in about 6 mos. Comcast couldn't help me reset my user name and tech support was not very helpful. Glad I didn't pay too much for it.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara A. Whitson

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the time and money for this product.
customer_reviews.text: I got this modem in 2013 and I used for one year then store it away for a while because I was traveling. I sat it up again in early June 2016 and it only worked 30% of the time. I was not sure it was the cable modem problem or the cable provider's service problem. I end up getting a new cable modem and the mystery was solved. This cable modem did not work well in 2013 and surely failed in 2016.
customer_reviews.author: LEE

customer_reviews.title: works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to avoid the $6 per month rental fee from my internet provider. After a little over a year it will have paid for itself. I had no trouble using the modem, but be aware you will have to contact your internet provider before the modem will work. I didn't have to worry about that since I had the modem before my installer arrived to install the internet.
customer_reviews.author: The Reviewer!

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly with Comcast
customer_reviews.text: After ~8 years of a $7/mo rental fee for a ~$80 modem, I decided I was done and I bought this Netgear model. It works great. Simple insulation; took maybe 2 minutes to setup, including removal of the old modem. Quick call to Comcast using the information provided in the packaging and you're off to the races. About 2 months later and zero issues. Great way to go if you're tired of being ripped off for equipment "rentals" that you've easily payed off 20 fold.
customer_reviews.author: Dan S

customer_reviews.title: looks like it's not working when it is
customer_reviews.text: weird lights, looks like it's not working when it is. Nonetheless, it has worked with cable internet for a year.. which is a miracle considering they only endorse their own rented modems (look it up, Xfinity may[?!$^] be using you as a hotspot).. Haven't benchmarked it or anything, but it seems to do just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Mostly problematic
customer_reviews.text: It works as designed, but not as good as the Motororla I had previously. Under heavy use, gaming, phone, tv, remote connections, etc., my home is not typical. I work remotely to my home computer and need a fast reliable modem, this one didn't quite work out because it dropped connections at least once a day. My previous Motorola never dropped connections and I only returned it due to the expensive rental fee. Better modem would be: ARRIS / Motorola SB6121 SURFboard DOCSIS 3.0 Cable Modem or similar Motorola.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a cable company modem with this to reduce my monthly cost. This modem has been rock solid since I bought it 5 years ago. Only down times have been when my internet provider was not working. Very pleased with the consistent operation.
customer_reviews.author: Hurricane Nate

customer_reviews.title: Tech says Netgear modems just aren't that good. Only good thing about this experience is there ...
customer_reviews.text: Went through 2 of these and still no luck. Sent the first one back thinking it was just a dud but had same problem...would not connect to and hold Brighthouse's internet signal. It was listed on their website as an acceptable modem. Tech says Netgear modems just aren't that good. Only good thing about this experience is there was no hassle from Amazon in sending a replacement and hopefully none when I send it back for my refund.
customer_reviews.author: DIYFAB

customer_reviews.title: Great cable modem
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this modem when I made the transition to cable internet. Cable companies will give you the option of renting their equipment, but in 5 months time, you could have purchased this one and owe no more on it. Cable companies also sell modems, but often times, they are outdated, old technology and not the best brand. I highly recommend netgear products. The only downside, is I've found their customer support to not be that fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: not a bad investment
customer_reviews.text: It definitely does the job, occasionally my router, plugged directly into this, had a problem, stops emitting wifi and needs to be turned off for three minutes to refresh something and works again. I have had no problem like this in the past at my other residence but it could be a whole slew of problems not related to this product. Much better then renting a modem from the cable company though and its great for apartments as its small and not incredibly ugly!
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell Smart

customer_reviews.title: Check to be sure you can use it first
customer_reviews.text: This modem doesn't actually work with Time Warner in our area. Netgear has been working with me for the last month trying to resolve the disconnect problem I've been having with the internet connection. Time Warner tech supervisor for our area (Antelope Valley) said he wishes Time Warners website would give the approved modem list by area & not worldwide. Before you purchase it I would ask Time Warner if they have had problems with this modem in your area. I love Netgear products but this one is clashing with our internet service provider, Time Warner.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: ran fine for 10 months then, not so much
customer_reviews.text: I've had this modem 11 months and am using it with COX. It was fine until a few weeks ago when all of a sudden it would drop connections and require constant reboots sometimes reconnecting for a few hours of sometimes not working at all. Called Cox and dealt with their people which is like a nightmare in itself and basically everything looked good on their end. I switched to a 5 year old motorola I had laying around that is less than half the speed of the CMD31T and it works just fine. Netgear won't take direct returns and it's past the amazon return period so basically now I am stuck with a 60$ paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: Igorian

customer_reviews.title: Died on me after 5 months.
customer_reviews.text: This worked GREAT for 5 months... and then one day, it just died. It was a dead piece of plastic, wasn't getting power to itself and none of the lights turned on anymore. I am not pleased. Update. June 2016. I bought a second modem, same model and it also died after seven months. With Comcast Internet service. This is a piece of junk I wouldn't spend your money on it. By Motorola router it is superior to Netgear
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Soto

customer_reviews.title: This one works so much better and we are actually saving money
customer_reviews.text: At my house we got sick of Comcast slow low end modem that would always would need to be reset every few weeks. This one works so much better and we are actually saving money. Rental cost was about $8/month this cost $75 when we got it, that means after 10 months we are saving money compared to if we rented. Also I hated that built in router it was terrible, but with modem this we can keep using our own router.
customer_reviews.author: Ram

customer_reviews.title: Has been working great, 24/7 for 3+ years
customer_reviews.text: Has been working great, 24/7 for 3+ years. No issues getting 12Mbs+ download, 2Mbs up provided by XFinity. In this time, I've only had to reboot 4 times due to XFinity issues. It's out lived all previous modems I've had.
customer_reviews.author: LJS566

customer_reviews.title: Very nice improvement over leased cable modem
customer_reviews.text: There was a bit of a glitch at first. It turned out to be some sort of set up issue at Time Warner, but they sent a tech out the same day to investigate, and had it up and running within minutes after the tech arrived. Since then it has run flawlessly. It consistently delivers the full turbo speed that I am paying for with TWC, which the leased modem had failed to do.
customer_reviews.author: R J W

customer_reviews.title: The first one didn't work: my service provider couldn't ...
customer_reviews.text: The first one didn't work: my service provider couldn't 'see' it on the network so it couldn't be provisioned. I exchanged it for another but it died after 5 months: it couldn't acquire an incoming signal, although the cable had a valid incoming signal. Both Time Warner and Cox have had problems with this modem. Get this one instead: NETGEAR N450 WiFi DOCSIS 3.0 Cable Modem Router (N450-100NAS)
customer_reviews.author: Scott Olson

customer_reviews.title: Another "works fine" for Time warner Cable
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for about 3 months. I purchased after TWC raised their monthly rental charge, but wish I made the switch sooner. I've had no problems. There was a bit of difficulty installing but the TWC person was able to work through it. I have up to 2 phones, 3 computers, and a tablet running though this and a Netgear router with no problem. I do have a separate Belkin Battery back-up for this (which was left for me by ATT when I moved from their service area.) It helps with the infrequent power surges we have out here in the country.
customer_reviews.author: SteveInTx

customer_reviews.title: Simply love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this modem to replace the Time Warner gateway supplied after moving recently. I chose it after reading reviews and because of my own personal experience with Netgear products. The TW supplied gateway was fast, but dropped offline at least once every ten minutes or so from the time it was installed until I replaced it after six days. The Netgear modem came with simple instructions for installation, and exactly how to notify Time Warner that I was switching from their device to my own. It's been five weeks now and I haven't had one problem with it.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis P

customer_reviews.title: IT knowledge required
customer_reviews.text: Nice design, gets the job done. However, if you're using a MAC and or don't have the knowledge to configure your devices to communicate through a modem that is not the equipment of your internet provider you may have difficulty using it. My provider was either unable or unwilling to assist me. Fortunately, I knew someone who could.
customer_reviews.author: E. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Randomly stops working
customer_reviews.text: Our internet randomly turns off. It happens like once a week, sometimes a little more or a little less. I have to reset the modem to fix it, which takes 15mins. Which can get annonying very fast. I contacted both Netgear and Time Warner Cable, both say it's the others falt. I do know this problem only started after I brought the modem.
customer_reviews.author: DTT San Diego

customer_reviews.title: Didnt work
customer_reviews.text: Product didn't work. Internet and cable was set up bit Internet didn't work. Cable guy had to come back and checked everything and the modem was not putting out signal when he tested it directly. Was listed as an approved modem for Comcast so this was a faulty product. I had to pay the $30 service fee for my Internet provider to tell my I bought a faulty product. Don't waste time buying used from seller Maggie Mae's Shoppe n' Shippe
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Functional, Attractive, Easy Set Up
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this modem. It is attractive, easy to set up and has clear signal lights. It is compatible with my internet carrier and saves me the expense of renting a modem from them. Do be careful to check the speed allowed before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Works Well -- Limited Internal Webserver & No Access Documentation
customer_reviews.text: This unit has been working perfectly for 60 days. No reboots required. The biggest drawback is that it has a very limited information-only internal web server. I had to convince Netgear to give me the IP address and password. They do not want you to see the performance values of your own Modem.
customer_reviews.author: R. Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Bought it new, after a few months it just quit working.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this modem a few months ago, and then out of nowhere, it just stopped working. Tried to return it and they said I was outside of the return window. Hard to believe for a $100 investment that they will not work with you. Had to replace with a new one. I highly advise staying away from this brand !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dave N.

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Modem works great. It is compatilble with TWC. I haven't noticed any problems, and provides a good strong signal to my router. I have numerous devices all connected to my internet, and this modem has no problem providing enough bandwith to the modem to handle all of it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this Netgear High Speed Cable Modem
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Comes as advertised. We could have paid the cable company $130 for a new modem - we chose to decline their offer and went online. We found the Netgear modem and we are very happy with the product. Delivered on time and in the promised condition. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mary R. Kolk

customer_reviews.title: Pretty disappointing. Not sure if it was the fault ...
customer_reviews.text: This was one of the few models that Time Warner allowed for buying your own cable modem to use with their service... Unfortunately I was not able to get it to connect, and the product never worked. I spent two days on the phone with the service provider and it was never able to connect. Pretty disappointing. Not sure if it was the fault of the used gear, or the service provider.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: This will not save you money on your cable bill
customer_reviews.text: This modem was really disappointing - I finally had to return the thing. I worked on trying to connect for 8 hours with on-line phone support and even had the cable technician come to the house. We tried everything and finally he said it's ng. Also my instructions were printed several years ago so one has to wonder if the technology is already too old.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy Install
customer_reviews.text: I have Windows 8 and a Netgear router so this model (no wifi) replaced my old modem from the cable company which I returned for credit. I no longer have to pay the monthly rental fee. Installation was a snap, unplugged old modem and plugged in the new one. The only thing that took time was waiting for my cable company to enter in the new mac id which comes right up on the screen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this to replace a Linksys modem because I was afraid of the Heartbleed bug/worm, which doesn't affect this modem. This did the trick. Activation was fast and simple, and I can even sign on to IPv6 websites with it! And BTW--The box said it doesn't work with TWC/Roadrunner, but it does. I'm using it right now!
customer_reviews.author: A. Nonymous

customer_reviews.title: Netgear High Speed Cable Modem
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when I ordered Comcast service, and it arrived on time, the day before the Comcast guy came to install service. When he hooked everything up, it didn't work (though the description said it supported Comcast cable internet). The installer did everything he could to try to set it up, to no avail, and ended up installing a Comcast box and adding monthly rental to my service fee - which I was trying to avoid. After he left, I did some Google searching, did some quick reading on the TCP/IP settings, and had the Netgear modem running within 10 minutes. I've had no problems with it since, and quickly returned the Comcast box.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Roy

customer_reviews.title: A Dud
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work right out of the box. The Comcast guy says he installs them everywhere and sometimes they work and sometimes they don't. This one was a dud. Replaced it with a different Netgear. Waiting to see if the new one works.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra L Ulsher

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after two months
customer_reviews.text: This modem worked great for about two months and then one day completely stopped working. We had our ISP come out and they determined the issue was with the modem, not the connection or any other device. I contacted the seller to resolve the issue and they never even responded. This shouldn't happen with a newly purchased product. I would not buy this again, and I wish I never bought it in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Sarena Bhatia

customer_reviews.title: Comcast Xfinity service
customer_reviews.text: I am using Comcast Xfinity internet at 50mb/s. Pretty fast if that number means nothing to you. Set up was easy. Just a power plug, Ethernet port to the router, and a cable line input. I connected everything, waited about fifteen minutes, then called Comcast to register the new modem. Everything works as expected. Netgear even provided a sticker on the instruction manual with the relevant information that Comcast needed, so I didn't have to try to look under the modem. Instructions also have questions to ask the operator in case you need them. Router came with the stand already attached, but it is removable in case you don't want it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Gets hot to the touch but good product.
customer_reviews.text: This product heats up a lot do not put in closed settings must keep in cool ventilated area. Overall it's a solid product however the over heating issue concerns me.
customer_reviews.author: Tovarizer

customer_reviews.title: Although Comcast (and my brother-in-law) did the installation, the ...
customer_reviews.text: Although Comcast (and my brother-in-law) did the installation, the modem is performing admirably in conjunction with the Netgear wireless router installed at the same time. The last tested download speed was 28 mbs and I've experienced no problems at all. I just use it for internet so I can't speak to TV performance but I have no reason to believe performance would be any less successful.
customer_reviews.author: tcellar

customer_reviews.title: awesome because i have it hooked up with the "NETGEAR ...
customer_reviews.text: Have this product and it converts my internet speed to the maximum in my area... awesome because i have it hooked up with the "NETGEAR Nighthawk AC1900 Dual Band WiFi Gigabit Router (R7000)" and it is super fast and i only pay for the chepest interner from my provider...
customer_reviews.author: Jose Maria Tamayo Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with WOW
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for a few months & then started losing internet every other week My internet provider wowway ( in kansas) says that the modem is the problem & infact the technician who came even had the picture of this "offending modem" from his supervisor on his phone They say that every time the firm ware updates something changes to make it stop working !!
customer_reviews.author: Akshat

customer_reviews.title: Could Not Boot Up with Time Warner
customer_reviews.text: After spending FOUR hours dealing with Time Warner support they said it could not fully boot up and complete the setup process. I rebooted it several times and reset it several times but no luck. Unfortunately I'm going back to using the TWC issued modem and returning this garbage. I have no plans on trying to work with Netgear's support on getting a replacement. That should never be necessary for a brand new product. Judging from all of these poor reviews, it appears the quality assurance department at Netgear needs some help!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer S.

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Comcast
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews that said this model didn't work with Comcast. I returned the old rented DOCSIS 2 modem, told the lady at the desk the Model number and MAC address of the new modem, and it was working in about 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: DFTycoon

customer_reviews.title: Much better than renting one from Time Warner.
customer_reviews.text: Bought the netgear high speed cable modem to replace the one Time Warner was renting to me. The part that I like most is that I no longer have to pay time warner 8 bucks a month. As far as performance I cannot tell the difference between this and the one that I was renting. I am paying for 30mbs internet and speed tests was pulling down at 32mbs.
customer_reviews.author: PG

customer_reviews.title: Great Wi-Fi and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I am saving monthly rentals and it works flawlessly. The setup was a breeze. Adding passwords and other devices is easy. I can use my wifi upstairs, downstairs and outside as well. I went from standard cable connection to turbo with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Maklv

customer_reviews.title: Arrived DOA
customer_reviews.text: Contacted Netgear as soon as figured out that the modem was dead. It would not power up. They replaced it free of change (well, I had to pay shipping to get the old one to them). If you are willing to wait 10 days for a replacement, it worked out OK--otherwise you can pay a premium. The replacement is working fine.
customer_reviews.author: PHirsc

customer_reviews.title: Great Modem
customer_reviews.text: There's not a lot I can say here. I use Comcast for internet, and their site directed me to this as a compatible modem. I plugged it in, called them up, and I was back online in minutes, minus $8 a month in "rental" fees. Pays for itself in less than a year.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan K. Price

customer_reviews.title: Great modem works perfect with Time Warner Cable AAA
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my leased modem with Time Warner Cable. Setup is easy, plug it in and hookup cable. I then went to TMC website and setup a chat session with a rep. It was fast and easy, they just want the MAC address from the modem and 2 minutes later internet was up and running. BTW i did all this at 3am, so the chat was super easy. Perfectly happy with the modem. I was getting about 20mbs now around 26... +++
customer_reviews.author: Troy L

customer_reviews.title: Lots of problems.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work. I've now returned two of these. The first would lose connecting requiring a reboot daily. The second one stays up but the speed ranges from ok to very slow. I originally bought to save $6 a month but I've spent hours and hours working with Netgear and TW techs trying to get this to work. I give up.
customer_reviews.author: djp001

customer_reviews.title: Very good, works perfect
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a "rented" one from local ISP...actually works much better than the fancy one they had given us. Have not had any problems with this and was very easily installed. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: PricklyPear

customer_reviews.title: be careful  cable companys...............................
customer_reviews.text: ordered this and then found out that carter cable has a company law that you can't use it they wont turn it on with their system they will make you use only their modems ! the stuff they dont tell their customers other wise i guess it would have worked fine .
customer_reviews.author: egbear7567

customer_reviews.title: Plugged it in, connected the cable, called TW ...
customer_reviews.text: Plugged it in, connected the cable, called TW with the MAC address. 20 minutes and a couple of reboots later it was up and running. Had to reboot it once, the following day (was concerned this may be an ongoing issue!), but since then it has been up all the time...several weeks now. No problems.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin K.

customer_reviews.title: Not compatable with my internet provider
customer_reviews.text: I use media com in eastern Iowa and when I connected this modem it wouldn't link back to my internet provider. Called media com support and found out that this modem is not compatible due to the firmware the modem uses. I was not able to use the modem so I don't know if it works well or not.
customer_reviews.author: damightyzug

customer_reviews.title: resets often
customer_reviews.text: got this because I was tired of paying Time Warner for anything. It often resets, but I don't know if this is because Time Warner is upset I don't have their modem, or just because its a fault of the modem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Modem Router Bundle works seamlessly
customer_reviews.text: I was afraid of throttling or causing a conflict with the new AC 1900 Nighthawk but this NETGEAR modem works great with the Wi-Fi router in the bundle. No problem with Comcast registering the CMD31T and it responded right away.
customer_reviews.author: RickW342

customer_reviews.title: It's fine, it works. yay.
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say about this item. It's a cable modem advertised to work at a certain speed. I expect it to work at that speed and not crash. It does. 4 stars instead of 5 because i'm not sure I could ever love a cable modem. It's fine.
customer_reviews.author: Scientist_B

customer_reviews.title: This was easy to set up, worked immediately as soon as Comcast sent the signal!
customer_reviews.text: This product was on the list of recommended/approved cable modems on Comcast's website. Since my wireless router is also by Netgear, it was a no brainer to choose the modem. They found each other immediately and I have not had any problems since its installation, which was done by me, a 61 yr old woman. Also, my computer and my iPad are smokin fast and I also use a Roku streaming device for movies, etc from Amazon and they are beautiful. What more can I say lol, I love it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Netgear DOCSIS 3.0 (CMD31T)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because Time Warner Cable started charging a lease for our cable modem. This unit allows us to have both VOIP and Internet. The unit seems a bit faster than the Motorola unit that was provided by TW, was quick and easy to configure and we have had zero issures or problems with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: So Cute! Yeah!
customer_reviews.text: The Netgear High Speed Cable Model - DOCSIS 3.0 (CMD31T) works better than the original cable modem I rented. Now, I have my own cable modem which helped to reduce my monthly cable bill. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: GLong

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: changed cable co and don't use it anymore. but worked flawless when used,
customer_reviews.author: Phil Tabakaru

customer_reviews.title: Can not maintain a internet connection.
customer_reviews.text: Modem is fast when it works, but does not work consistently. It drops out easily and needs to be reset constantly. It took me a few calls with the cable company to isolate the issue to the modem. I should have done more research because it's clear from the reviews this isn't a reliable product. Returned after 24 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Kamyar Setvanpour

customer_reviews.title: Good Unit for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Installation and contacting Time Warner was easy getting the unit installed and activated. Once installed I had a problem with the unit dropping the internet connection once or more per day. After a few days of intermittent drops I had Time Warner send a tech. After some checks the wall connection being replaced I have not had a single drop out. Very good value for the price. I especially like saving the lease charge each month.
customer_reviews.author: Rockin' On Porch

customer_reviews.title: Fast cable modem!
customer_reviews.text: High-speed cable modem, works flawlessly for me but now I have FTTH (fiber to the home) in our new house and don't need this one, however we had no problems with it and it worked really well.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Great high speed modem!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and it works flawlessly out of the box. I called my ISP and gave them the data they needed about the modem and hooked it right up. Netgear always makes quality products!
customer_reviews.author: Polar Bear

customer_reviews.title: Try another
customer_reviews.text: Got this because our old one went on the fritz after having it for years. Had this one for a month and 18 days- it has stopped working and the warranty time is past by 18 days
customer_reviews.author: PCH

customer_reviews.title: This is the worst cable modem on the market.
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst cable modem on the market. Lasted 3 months and the company has failed to warranty the product. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Treese

customer_reviews.title: Solid depandable router!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this for a couple of years now and it is still going strong without troubles, more than I can say for many other routers I have had in the past!
customer_reviews.author: Big Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Drops connection often.
customer_reviews.text: If possible, pick another modem. The CMD31T started off well enough but then started dropping connection and it was very hard to get back. I thought it was my ISP but they came out and checked the lines and verified there was service. After several reboots and resets of the modem the internet returned, only to be dropped again the next day. Device is unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Really nice product.
customer_reviews.text: I was paying the cable company $5.00 a month to rent their's for years, so the pay back on the Netgear modem will take some time but worth it as my down load speed is much higher.
customer_reviews.author: J. Famularo

customer_reviews.title: Does what it said on the box, Comcast decided ...
customer_reviews.text: Does what it said on the box, Comcast decided that my DOCSIS 2 modem had come to end of life, didn't see any change from Netgear to Motorola, both 30mbit download!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: N. Ashburner

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Modem
customer_reviews.text: Works great with cable internet. Much better than paying $8 monthly for a rental modem from your cable provider when you can outright own one within a years time. Especially, if you are going to be using cable internet for years anyway. Lightning fast. Handles lots of bandwidth.
customer_reviews.author: timwalls2

customer_reviews.title: Incompatible Atlantic Broadband
customer_reviews.text: I work for Atlantic Broadband and purchased this on behalf of the cable company. Our engineers could not get this model to run consistently and was subsequently removed from our compatibility list. You have been warned.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Locke

customer_reviews.title: Works fine once you get going
customer_reviews.text: My first unit wouldn't connect by the Ethernet port. The Netgear support team is fantastic and called me back a couple of times to track the replacement from Amazon to make certain it was working for me. The replacement unit still take a long time to reconnect to the Internet when it gets unplugged or powered cycled, and often requires a second power cycle to successfully connect.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: It does what you need it to do without any trouble. If you don't want to rent one this is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Binkley

customer_reviews.title: I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.text: I needed to update my modem. I have Cox as a provider. I prefer having separate modem and router because I think it provides more security to your home network. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Reina

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to install with help from Cox's online tech team
customer_reviews.text: I needed to upgrade my modem to take advantage of the faster service that Cox was offering. This modem was on their list of compatible modems. It was easy to install with help from Cox's online tech team.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Korinek

customer_reviews.title: Bought this just over a year ago. Stopped working ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this just over a year ago. Stopped working today. Would not have purchased this had I known it was only going to last 1 year. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: amanda bryant

customer_reviews.title: DOCSIS 3.0
customer_reviews.text: I needed an upgrade and went by the reviews of this unit. It was accepted into the COX network and automatically was updated to the latest version. Nothing more to say.
customer_reviews.author: Orv

customer_reviews.title: Seems good so far
customer_reviews.text: Seems good so far. I am skeptical as I always seem to have trouble with Time Warner Cable, but it is working right now. It was easy to setup and I had no trouble adding on the wifi router.
customer_reviews.author: Ann-Marie Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: Still works after 9mo
customer_reviews.text: Bought the product in December 2012 and have not had any issues so far. It tend to run a bit warm. Keep it in area with plenty of airflow and it should be alright.
customer_reviews.author: AlexT

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Great investment
customer_reviews.text: I bought this modem so I wouldn't have to rent one from a cable company. So far so good. Great investment. I've had a solid internet connection running for about a year without any problems so far.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Good, reliable modem
customer_reviews.text: Chose this based on my cable provider reccomendations-easy to set up (basically plug it in). Good way to hook cable into existing network-versus using cable supplied router.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen M. Ouellette

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I've had this cable modem for about two weeks using timewarner cable in california. It works well and have had no connections issues so far. It does however get a little hot. I hope this thing lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Smithers

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT cable modem
customer_reviews.text: Don't rent yours from the cable company (they get enough money from all of us), just buy this one instead and it will pay for itself in a year. Mine works great.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Merri Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Good modem for TWC
customer_reviews.text: This is the modem i had to buy to get out of paying rent to TWC. I don't notice any difference in performance but I don't think that was the point. It works, was easy to set up and that's all that counts.
customer_reviews.author: Coconutwireless

customer_reviews.title: so good, 6 months later
customer_reviews.text: so far, so good, 6 months later. easy to install and haven't had to think about it since the first day.
customer_reviews.author: DJG

customer_reviews.title: great deal
customer_reviews.text: this is a great modem and they have it priced really reasonable. I have it on my system with 2 tp link products a wifi router & a 8 port wired router. workes great..
customer_reviews.author: sehelfer

customer_reviews.title: As advertised works well with TW cable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased because I needed 3.0 for high speed service. Working well so far. TW did not know this modem and it took a few days to get set up
customer_reviews.author: C. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Really impressed how easy it is to use this modem and connect to ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered self install kit from comcast and connected using modem. Online in less than 10 minutes - no call to comcast or netgear. Really impressed how easy it is to use this modem and connect to comcast. I got all the speed mentioned in my order from day one. I had this over a week now. So far no reboot required.
customer_reviews.author: Sreeni K.

product_meta.title: NETGEAR DOCSIS 3.0 - High Speed Cable Modem (CMD31T)
product_meta.description: The NETGEAR High Speed Cable Modem provides a connection to high-speed cable Internet. It provides up to 150 Mbps download and upload speed for streaming HD videos, faster downloads, and high-speed online gaming. High-performance - Up to 150 Mbps download and upload speed for streaming HD videos, faster downloads, and high-speed online gaming. Compatible with major Cable Internet Service Providers like Charter, Cable Vision, Cox, Time Warner Cable and others. Cost-effective - Saves money over time. No monthly equipment charges required from your ISP Gigabit Ethernet port - Fastest wired speeds to connect your router or computer Simple - CD-less installation
feature_bullets: The NETGEAR High Speed Cable Modem provides a connection to high-speed cable Internet. Item is CABLE MODEM ONLY
Compatible with U.S. cable Internet providers like Spectrum, Cox, Cablevision & more
High-performance - Up to 150 Mbps download and upload speed for streaming HD videos, faster downloads, and high-speed online gaming
Cost-effective - Saves money over time. No monthly equipment charges required from your ISP
Gigabit Ethernet port - Fastest wired speeds to connect your router or computer

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars641 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
